intro: Leucadendron thunbergii, commonly known as the Silver Tree, is a striking evergreen shrub or small tree native to South Africa. It is characterized by its silvery-white, fuzzy foliage that gives it a unique appearance. The plant produces vibrant red or orange spherical flower heads that bloom in spring and summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its drought tolerance and ability to attract birds and insects make it both visually appealing and ecologically beneficial.
